etymologies: early 18th century: from Latin nerita, from Greek nēritēs ‘sea mussel’, from the name of the sea god Nereus

definitions: a chiefly tropical mollusk with a somewhat globe-shaped and brightly marked shell, typically found in water.

notes.text: Superfamily Neritacea, class Gastropoda: several genera and species, including the European freshwater snail Theodoxus fluviatilis

shortDefinitions: chiefly tropical mollusc with somewhat globe-shaped and brightly marked shell
